website_summaries.verdict: This dome is a great playground for kids to enjoy creative and active play.
pros: Not terribly difficult to put together
A very versatile and long-lasting playground piece for your backyard
Easy to move to protect the grass underneath but sturdy enough for kids to be able to be rough on it
cons: Does not attach to the ground to provide added safety and structure

customer_reviews.title: We love this dome
customer_reviews.text: We love this dome. It is very sturdy and after reading the full manual twice it was easy to put together with two adults. The only issue was it created a Thunderdome in my back yard. The children started chanting two kids enter one kid leaves. The benefit is there is now a venue for solving all arguments.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Joshua

customer_reviews.title: We added a swing to it &  now it's like a mini playground!
customer_reviews.text: We love this dome climber. We've had it for 3 years and it's still a hit... still looks new... still nice and sturdy! We added a Little Tikes Disc Swing to it and it works great! It adds another element of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Anne V.

customer_reviews.title: Rust after 6months
customer_reviews.text: We have bought about 1year ago. My daughter still love this dome a lot however start getting rusted links. Hope it will last longer but looks like, it won't last as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: It feel like this was a really good deal at $150
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas along with this20 ft. parachute to throw over the top, so she can use it as a fort. She loves it! She can climb all over it, us it as a fort, camp out in the back yard in it... It's very multi-purpose. We hung a little hammock up in there too. It feel like this was a really good deal at $150. It's really heavy duty and looks like it will last forever. It looks nice in the yard, too. I like the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dugger

customer_reviews.title: This is really cool and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool and durable. It was very hard for me to put together though. Definitely needs two people. You have to hold it just right for it to all fit in the small bolts. It has to be that way but it's hard. My kids love it though and so do some adults 😊. It's pretty cool. I have a 10 yr old boy and an 8 year old girl and a 34 year old man playing on it haha
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: The quality is amazing , my kids love it and I'm buying another one
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write this review because we have had other play equipment that just fell apart over time. THIS however is not one of those kinds of equipment!!!! We've owned this 3 years now. There isnt a child that came over that didnt climb on it, its survived hurricane Matthew and Irma, the extreme heat of florida and excessive amounts of rain and it still looks brand new!!!! My children are on it all day everyday. Ages 2, 3 , 4 and 7. Even I climb on it with them. We added a little tykes disc swing to the middle also which they all love too.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Swift

customer_reviews.title: Major Rust!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item as a Christmas present for our children now just 2 years later it is completely rusted through to the point the kids can’t use it. 1/3 of the supports have so much rust that they either broke or are hanging on by a thread. Extremely disappointing because the kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen P

customer_reviews.title: Hold off before buying!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! I will update if manufacturer handles properly, but put this together last night and on this first day of use today, a piece BENT! This should not happen on day 1. Very disappointed. Will follow up after I talk to company. Otherwise I am returning if they won’t resolve. Very scary - !
customer_reviews.author: B. M.

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after 1 year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Review after 1 year of use. We bought the dome in June of 2017. Kids love to climb on it and everything was great until today( September 2018). We were taking it apart for the storage and realized that the frame started to rust on each rail that was on bottom. I understand that we had rough winter,spring and rainy summer. But I wouldn't think that can happen after 1 year of use. Sadly but we just going to trash it for now. Very disappointed in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Four grandkids ages 9-3 love this dome.
customer_reviews.text: Four grandkids ages 9-3 love this dome. It has been a house, a teepee, an igloo and a play dome. They spend hours climbing and swinging. It seems sturdy enough as my 200 lb son-in-law climbs all over it too!
customer_reviews.author: Paper SlaveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 4 year old and 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 4 year old and 7 year old. 4 year old can't really climb on most of it yet, but will grow into it. I can't give it 4 stars, because some piece are slightly rusted already! Bought "pre-opened" on Amazon, but still looked in perfect shape - aside from the fact that some pieces are rusting a tiny amount already. Wonder what it will look like in 5 years. For now, the colors are gorgeous though. I'm a fit woman and put this entire thing together by myself in under 3 hours. Would have been easier and faster with help, but I wanted to surprise everyone before they came home.
customer_reviews.author: Police Motors

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for about 2.5 years. Warranty is poor.
customer_reviews.text: The Geodome was decently sized and sturdy. As rust began to form the the connection points for the bars, we contacted the company to see about it being warrantied... and they would not honor it against corrosion. At about 2.5 years it was no longer safe to play on as bars were breaking. I broke it apart by hand for the most part and set it on the curb to be picked up with the trash. They airplane was bought the same time and won’t last another year for the same reason. I do live inland as well in the southeast, so it is not exposed to any salt.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's a pain to put together, but the kids loved it once it was done. I will say trying to follow the directions was frustrating and I ended up messing up at first. I then threw out the directions and started from the ground up putting it together. It worked out much better after the bottom circle was complete. The directions have you undo bolts and add bars anyway so it really wasn't any worse doing it this way. I am a girl and I did it basically by myself in 4 hours with a toddler and a baby home. (Could have had it done in 3 if they weren't so "helpful")
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Sikes

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for the kiddos
customer_reviews.text: First things first, it will take some time to put together. I'm no amateur to assembling stuff and it took around 2 hours. Its built pretty sturdy, I sure climbed on it and played with the kids. I'm 220lbs and it holds just fine. It's not heavy but not so light a little wind will take it. Easy enough to move when it's time to move. My 2yr old loves it and my older boys 9 and 10 play on it also. Package came quick and wasnt missing anything. I seen others had problems and missing items but not use. I would recommend it's a blast. Looking to get the swing for the middle
customer_reviews.author: Bryan magliazzo

customer_reviews.title: Directions
customer_reviews.text: As with most DIY assembly directions, the pictures and diagrams are a lot easier to follow than the written steps. Took me 2 hours to assemble mine around two (2) palm trees. I live in Florida, so having two trees anchoring it down saves me the additional steps of anchoring it down to be "Hurricane Compliant".
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Waters

customer_reviews.title: Build PSA: 2 Person Project, Must Like Puzzles!
customer_reviews.text: This structure is AWESOME! And big! (We got biggest size) A few helpful hints to know before you buy: - You MUST have 2 people to build/hold pieces up while attaching or it will take you a very long time. - 1/2” socket wrench is required for attaching “rock climbing nubs” to angles - To build you must enjoy puzzles as you are constantly assembling and then disassembling pieces to add more pieces. (This is not a straightforward project) - The directions are a little confusing. For clarification sides are built separately first, then assembled, then top and bottom pieces added. -Once finished your kid(s) are going to LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best Outdoor entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this geodome. I set it up the day before Christmas, and though it took me 3 hours it was well worth the time. It will take at least 2 people to put together but is fairly easy if you understand you are not building it from the top down. You are actually building 5 wall pieces, the base, and then the top. If I had understood this, we might have completed the build in about 1.5 hours. Either way, the geodome is VERY sturdy and we have piled 4-6 kiddos on it at a time without any problem. I love to look out the back window and see the kids having fun outdoors on this geodome!
customer_reviews.author: Malissa L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun. The kids love it. I love it. This will build up their strength while everyone else is turning their kids into couch potatoes/gamers. They will grow up to rule the world all because one man decided to change everything and buy a ...jungle gym. (Sideshow bob laughter) Just make sure you check the black knobs regularly to make sure they stay right. I can hop my resistance bands to this and get a killer workout. I can get my practice sword and pretend I’m in a Shaw brothers movie. It makes the exact same sound. Oh yeah the kids like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Da Man

customer_reviews.title: Awesome climber but tedious to build.
customer_reviews.text: This was a little tedious to put together. It took us a solid 2 hours to put together with interruptions from our kids. You will need a socket wrench and regular half inch wrench to put it together. Two people are a must in my opinion. It gets slippery when wet and it is huge. My kids love it and have to be bribed to stop playing. I have an average sized 4 year old and he loves it although has to work on his gross motor skills. My 90% height 2 year old loves it too. Going to be purchasing a circle swing and parachute to make it a fort next!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice dome at great price!
customer_reviews.text: Was easier to put together with two people. I tried doing it myself but found it challenging. Once assembled, very sturdy! Kids love it. We put a rope swing in the middle as others have and kids like swinging on it more than climbing. I bought a swing set too so kids have a nice little playground in the backyard. Great exercise and teaches kids good balance and climbing skills!
customer_reviews.author: LANCE

customer_reviews.title: Great Dome for 5 year old and 8 year old! Held my husband too!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sturdy dome! It does get very HOT! My husband and I built it outside on a very hot Florida afternoon! Needless to say we both got sun burned and felt the effects of the Sun! But that’s on us! As for the dome it was a bit of a puzzle to build and had many components that needed to be bent into position. But my husband did a GREAT job! Our kids LOVED it!!! They use it as part of their “challenge” outdoors. It’s great now that we are “safe at home” due to Corona Virus!
customer_reviews.author: Yanai

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty nice. Our 5 year old likes it quite a bit. The 2 year old like running around the inside and hanging on the lower bars. It's sturdy and well made. Assembly took a couple hours. The instructions are pretty good, but there are steps where you attach things temporarily and then have detach and add more bars to it later. It would be nice if they warned about that so I didn't fully tighten them the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T.

customer_reviews.title: Giant dome...a little tough to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This was not easy to put together. Directions were great, but in the end I had to use all my strength to get things to fit. Reason being is that the tab tops of the bars bend a bit and some were mishapen while building. In the end it took me...1 person, about 3 hours to put together. Make sure you have a ratchet and a good wrench. It is sturdy, but I can see areas already where the paint will chip and possible rusting will occur. I added a swing and a trapeze bar for fun. My daughter loves it....oh. It’s huge!!!!
customer_reviews.author: NihaoHolaAloha

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for many ages
customer_reviews.text: This was a “quarantined with 3 kids who still need to be outside and away from people” purchase. It’s working out great for my 3, 8, and 11 year old! They are happy to move their bodies in the fresh backyard air. It was ordered, shipped, delivered, and assembled (2 people, 2 hours) in 4 days. Just what we needed right now.
customer_reviews.author: JillT

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy quality made product. Install took about an hour or two one person. My son(6) loves it! Very happy with our purchase and would highly recommend for kiddos of all ages. My 3 year old hasn’t climbed it yet but then again she isn’t as much of a climber as my son. My 1.5 yr old son can’t wait to climb with his brother, he’s tried but thankfully it’s too big for him so no worrying about the littles getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They really loved it, although they did lose interest after awhile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandchildren. They really loved it, although they did lose interest after awhile. My husband and son-in-law put it together in about two hours, I think. It is sturdy but can still be picked up and moved by two people for mowing under it. I bought the green and brown and like how it blends in with the grass. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the package with all the screws and hardware came open during shipping, and it was a mess. Fortunately all the necessary hardware was loose in the box and hadn't fallen out (the box also had a hole in it).
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...with a slight modification
customer_reviews.text: This climbing dome is very sturdy and my kids are loving it. I bought it for my son's third birthday, because he loves climbing and can handle the dome at our local park with ease. However, the bars on this dome are spaced further apart then he's used to, which resulted in a pretty disappointed, frustrated boy. I used a rope to help make up the difference and he was off! He definitely can't use it unless I'm right there with him, but he's getting more confident with each climb, so hopefully I can remove the rope soon. My five (4'7") and seven (4'9") year olds have no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: MACLS08

customer_reviews.title: Need Help to Put Together
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 hours to put together. I definitely needed help putting the sides together. Thankfully my 13 year old son wanted to help. It was not as hard as I thought it would be, but still a lot of work. It seems sturdy. There are things that are not perfect about the design, but such is the way with engineering these types of things. I like that the kids can play with this outdoor toy in many different creative ways. The bars are pretty far apart. Our tiny 2 year old has trouble climbing to the top, but she still made it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: great dome climber
customer_reviews.text: The installation was easier than I thought. It took my husband about two hours with a little help from me. We are slow in assembling equipment, so I think many people would take less than one hour to complete the task. We set the dome indoor in one of the bedrooms. The kids love to climb high above and around the entire dome overlooking the faraway mountains or scenery. A good way to practice rock-climbing. They also like to hang themselves upside down or swing around on the bars. During Covid-19 quarantine, it is a great indoor exercise equipment for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Athena C

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t fun or easy to play on
customer_reviews.text: I set this up with my Dad in about an hour. It helps having lawn space to set the extra parts on. I really dislike how big the metal bars are, and how slippery the coating is. None of it is easy to swing around on, as an adult or a kid. The injury potential scares me most as a mother... I only allowed my kid to go to the top when I was under her. However, I see potential in this for other things. Stringing lights on the poles would make for a cool hideout spot at night. A hammock or tiny swing would be nice also. Besides that, I say this was a waste of money and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Top

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved this
customer_reviews.text: 6 years later, this has had plenty of use by 3 kids. Has survived 6 winters and summers in the Midwest. If you’re putting this in the back yard, I’d recommend to think carefully about placement (or tarp the ground and use filling)and mowing the yard. It does go out of shape when moving which does bend the bars. Mine gets moved around at least once a week. But it still stands and can be played on. Eventually though one of the bars will end up breaking.
customer_reviews.author: TGirl2003

customer_reviews.title: Great for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Takes two folks to assemble or you will spend a lot of time doing so. I suggest you take out the instructions the night before and read them. Play close attention to the COLORS. The structure is build on colors and start of wrong and you have to disassemble it. Very tedious but read the instructions and layout a plan and you can fix it. Took my son and I about 4 hours. If I had to do another one it would take less time but you need someone to hold the lock nuts sometimes because of the size of it. The grand-kids love it. Even the 2 year old was able to climb it.
customer_reviews.author: Morpheus

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful following the directions for building this jungle gym. The poles make look the same but they aren't! We figured it out close to the end and had to disassemble a portion of it. It's very sturdy once you get it put together and even us adults can climb on it. It can be moved around for mowing but don't drag it! Always use to strong adults or several non-strong adults to lift it and move it. As soon as you try to "drag" it, it'll start flexing and bending. It was very worth the money and the colors are super bright!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J.

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool. Took my husband about 3 hours to put together solo. He said it wasn’t hard but time consuming. My son is 3.5 and average height and can climb pretty well unassisted. We added a rope ladder, swing, and rings to add to this and it is a big hit!!!! So far it’s only been one day but I think this was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shajj

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I have very active children who love to play outside. This was a PERFEFT addition to our back yard. It's not TOO big, but it's not too small. It's very well made, very sturdy. My husband put it together by himself in just a few hours. It wasn't difficult. I love that it comes with the knotches for the kids to grip or step on as they climb. I plan to purchase a 20 ft tent in the near future to put over this dome to make it the ultimate "fort" for camping outside on warm nights. This will be used in our home for many years to come. Highly recommend this geodome!! It arrived quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSki1008

customer_reviews.title: Kids really like it!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a year now and am really happy with it. Assembly wasn't too bad. It's very big and sturdy and I trust my kids climbing all over this. It's perfect for our 5-6 year old, and the 2.5 year old is starting to get the hang of it. I wouldn't recommend it for young toddlers but by 3 they're able to make great use of it. Good with a swing in the middle and blankets to make a fort. Only downside is that it needs two adults to reposition, but if you're keeping it in the same spot all the time that's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: sarki7

customer_reviews.title: Loving it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 6 year old son and 2 year old daughter as a joint birthday gift. It is a huge hit! All the kids at the party liked it (ages 2-10) and even some of the adults were trying to climb on it. It's great for imaginative play and great for gross motor development. Of course, it is well used in the summer, but we're hoping to put a tarp on it this winter and turn it into an igloo when the snow starts flying. Assembly was a little tricky -- a two person job for sure, but seems very sound and we're a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey W

customer_reviews.title: Can hold mom and dad, too!
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing! I looked up so many climbers trying to find one that would hold a good amount of weight, not just overall but in one place so that I (165#) or my husband (200#) could also play on it. I went through reviews and found one on this climber that had a photo of a dad standing on the top! Needless to say, we went with this one and we are definitely happy with our purchase. Also, my husband put it together by himself and it took a few hours. Hope my review helps! (Photo of my kids, I don’t have one with me and hubby :-( )
customer_reviews.author: MirandaD06

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and huge
customer_reviews.text: This is so big and my boys LOVE it (aged between 4-8)! We are thinking about going out and getting more "heavy duty" screws and bolts since 2 of them broke while assembling it but they put extras in there so we were still able to put it together nicely. It's not that heavy so my husband can easily move it by himself when it's time to mow but yet is heavy enough that I'm concerned about wind catching it. I'm eager to see how it holds up this winter since we're in North Dakota and we experience negative degree weather, high winds, and heavy snow. So far it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: MomofBoys

customer_reviews.title: A PITA to build, a joy to climb on
customer_reviews.text: So don't do like I did and try to assemble this after dark, because you'll likely miss the fact that there are multiple lengths of same-colored struts, and they have to go together in a specific order for maximum sturdiness. I absolutely love the end result (as much for me as for my toddler) and I absolutely will sell this ASSEMBLED when she eventually tires of it. Or just keep it as a lawn ornament until it rusts into pieces in 20+ years. Because I am NEVER disassembling this again.
customer_reviews.author: R.Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: The intructions are clear you just have to pay attention to the smaller print at the bottom. Definatly have two people to build. As advertised the paint does keep the dome from getting hot to the touch in sunny weather. Some of the paint came off during assembly due to me bending the ends to fit together properly. We set ours up on the lawn so moving it to mow is challenging but not impossible. For the price I would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Onza 2006

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Young Kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this climber. They've been on it every day since we purchased it. We hang hammocks on the inside and they use it for lounging. I tie sheets across the top to block the sun and it's an extra shady space. It's great. Big enough for my tall 7 year old to enjoy but my 2.5 year old can climb on the first level too. Putting it together started with just me, but I needed my husband to get the rest once the top started coming together. Just needs two people to hold the thing up as it comes together. But it was fairly simple and well explained.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Paszek

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the packaging missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the bad review only is that when it arrived it did not have some of the pieces the instruction book and the washers were not in the box we had to go look online for a video to explain how to put it together and are used the washers that I had at home. It was very Frustrating. It definitely takes a good four hours to assemble if you have the proper equipment. I ended up having to hire someone to do it. Otherwise I never would’ve been able to let the kiddos use it
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great backyard addition
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! The kids love it. It took awhile to assemble but my husband actually did it entirely on his own. He can manage to move it on his own when he needs to cut the grass too. The kids climb all over it, even the 3 year old. And it’s a great drying rack for when the kids are done swimming in the pool too! Hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Hardware missing, not for little kids. Otherwise good.
customer_reviews.text: The box came broke open and the washers were falling out. There were not enough washers to complete the assembly. We were able to buy more. Besides that my husband put it together alone in a couple hours. He said it wasn't hard but just a lot of steps. It says it's for 3-10 yr olds. My kid is almost 4 and average size. She cannot climb this at all. She is excited about it and we will use it as a fort and I bought a swing to hang from it so she can use it still until next year when she is big enough to climb it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki F.

customer_reviews.title: Set aside a day for installation
customer_reviews.text: This geodome came well packaged and labeled, and instructions were surprisingly very good. However this was easily the hardest thing I've ever built - protip, get a friend, lots of beers, a lot of shade, and set aside a day for installation. Also a 13mm socket tool as the rock climbing grips have deep-set nuts. It looks to be very well made, powdercoated, doesn't get too hot. It's heavy, liftable with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyma45

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE ASSEMBLY!
customer_reviews.text: Love this done! But READ THIS BEFORE ASSEMBLING! Do not use a power wratchet/ driver drill to tighten the lock nuts unless you are completely assembled and doing the final tighten and never plan to take it apart again! The power ratchet stripped all the nuts and broke them and we couldn't take them back off the add the final bars 😳🤦🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️ Anyways, I suggest doing all tightening by hand until you are finished. Ok, assembly aside, read the whole book before you assemble and you will see what I mean. It's a great jungle gym and my kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Momma in Montana

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy play structure
customer_reviews.text: When assembling this, be sure to take your time and look at the instructions carefully. And follow them exactly. If you don't you will find parts later on will not fit together the way they should (speaking from experience). It's really not that hard to construct, just pay attention to the directions. It will take two people when you begin attaching the smaller assembled sections together so plan to have a helper. Our girls love this and it looks like it will hold up for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 3 year old and an 18 month old.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking my kids might have to grow into it, but they both love it. It's only been up for a few hours. My three year old seems to see it as some sort of little play house and my 18 month old hangs off the bottom bar like she's on monkey bars ...so cute! It took my husband (alone) about 4-5 hours to put it together. We also have a Lifetime swing set (with bucket seats) in Earthtone. Love these colors in the yard. They look great with the dead grass.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: *We just put this up, so I'll be coming back down the road to update review* My hubby and I put this together (5ftx10ft) Christmas Eve night. Yes, in the dark, lol. It definitely made it more of a challenge using just a headlamp, but overall it was not hard. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS VERY CAREFULLY. There are specific ways to line up the bars. We spent 2 hours total. My kids are almost 4 & 7. They're quickly getting the hang of it, having a great time! I ordered a disc swing to put in the center, I Know they'll love that.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Anna

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny especially during Covid. Easy to customize with a hammock or swing disc. If it rains use a tarp and you have an instant igloo! Has so many ways to play. Great size for my bigger kids and even my 3yr old is able to play (though slower as the frame is big for his reach) Set up was a pain but not impossible. We didn't use their directions but rather built the frame from the ground up to make it possible for one person to do easily.
customer_reviews.author: K. B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: This definitely took a little effort to assemble, but is very sturdy once complete. My husband and I swapped off working on it and had it completed over the course of an afternoon. After being assembled, it was easy to move across the yard and it is sturdy enough for my husband to climb on. Our son is 3.5 and is able to climb and play on it now, and I'm sure will continue to play on it for quite a long time (I wouldn't recommend it for anyone younger, personally). It looks really nice in our yard, especially for a "play" item. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a year ago for our then 3 and 5 year old grandchildren. They loved it then, still love it, and have a great time swinging and climbing and running around this dome. The colors have not faded and it looks attractive set up in the yard, something to consider because you can't quickly take it down. Once it's built, it can be moved around to different sections of the yard. Their parents sometimes hang a swing from the center and the kids really like this added feature.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Great climber for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We love our climber! It was a bit of a beast to put together, but for the price it's a great addition to the yard. Sturdy, but light enough to pick up and move it to a different area of the yard. Good for all kinds of creative play. They can hang on it, climb it, throw balls through the openings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Quarantine Addition!
customer_reviews.text: It’s quite labor intensive to put together, but once it’s together it’s solid! With quarantine, we needed to add some fun to the back yard without spending thousands. This was just the right decision! It still looks brand new a month later and is the perfect addition to our yard! Pro Tip: buy a disc swing to hang from the middle bar. Most are too long, but you can alter it to hang just right! We hung one in the center and the kids love it! (Ages 2 and 7)
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie L. Yandell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this climbing down we don’t bought it April 2020 a.k.a. quarantine time! I have a five-year-old and a three-year-old and we weren’t able to go to a playground this was a great affordable option! Tons of fun we also bought a swing that we attached to the center and has added to the fun for the boys! I did put this together by myself and I will say there was one point that I really wish I had someone to help me... but I did it! Overall it’s great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Solid after 4 months of daily use
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a pain to assemble. It took two of us 2 hours. But you only have to do that once. Once assembled, it’s strong and nice to look at. I run a child care center and this is easily their favorite outdoor item. The kids are 2-10yrs old and they all enjoy it. I even use it for inclined pushups and pull ups. I’m in the upper Midwest and it has weathered our wind, storms and humidity very well. I’ll update if that changes over the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole in WI

customer_reviews.title: Rusts like crazy every knob section is rusted Don’t waste your money with if its really lifetime!
customer_reviews.text: Rusted on every section less than a year!! There promise is RUST FREE FOR LIFE! I’m so peturbed bc it’s supposed to be a LIFETIME PRODUCT! My kids deserve better and for the price I paid, So do I!!! I also want to add, after going out there and really looking at it I started spraying to keep from rusting further and I noticed how very cheap the metal is. Its Bendable, BENDING. i have a 4 and 5 year old. im most mad the window to return closed only 5 months ago!
customer_reviews.author: h03angel

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it and was not hard to install. Just takes a while.
customer_reviews.text: This cannot be installed without another pair of hands. However it’s not hard to put together at all. My kids were my helpers. You just need someone to hold part of the frames as you get the bolts in. The size is great and the kids absolutely love it. They played all day on it and in it and making up games. It’s an outdoor toy that opens up their imagination. You definitely need room for this though and level ground.
customer_reviews.author: dru1313

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 people 3 or 4 hours to assemble, but our 5 year old and 3 year old love it! We put it inside for the winter months and plan to move it outside when it warms back up. We have had a bunch of adults and children on at the same time, very sturdy. It is pretty big. We fit a queen size mattress under it with extra space to move around it. About 5 feet tall.
customer_reviews.author: PipersMom

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected but kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to set up by myself, but it's huge! Make sure to read the dimensions before ordering :-) We added a little rope swing in the middle which was a great addition. The only thing I have to criticize is the hardware (allen wrench, nuts and bolts) that came with it. They could be a bit sturdier and wash out easily if you're not careful. By the time I was done the allen wrench looked pretty twisted...
customer_reviews.author: JWPau

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this over a year ago and it's really holding up well. I thought it might start looking dirty but it's not yet. It doesn't get really hot in the sun, but it can be slippery when wet. It was a lot of work to put together, took two guys. I did not notice when purchasing and wish I had thought about it then, but the bars are not level. So for a new climber, or smaller person, it makes it really hard to figure out how to get up when feet are not level and tend to slip. Overall we love it and my son uses it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieF

customer_reviews.title: Good backyard fun!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 3 and 5 year old love this dome! They are average height and strength, so they cannot yet swing their legs up to the lowest horizontal bar and pull themselves up, but with a little lift from an adult or boost from a stool or chair, they manage pretty easily. We utilize the steps from a mobile slide we have and it works well. We did buy a disc swing for the center and weaved it through the top bars to adjust the length. I was a little concerned that the metal would get too hot to make this useful during the TX summers, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H

customer_reviews.title: Investment to keep the kids busy and occupied.
customer_reviews.text: This a long overdue review. We have a huge backyard and we need a place where kids can play and hang around. So we added this along with a playgroud and a trampoline. This is some thing where they can climb up and hang up side down from. This product stand the abuse of toddles and kids... along with the harsh elements of texas weather. This is a good investment to keep the kids busy and occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but instructions need to be improved
customer_reviews.text: Took a good 2-3 hours to assemble. Had to run to the hardware store to get a type of wrench that would fit inside the sockets on handles you put on screws at the end. Assembly was though because you need to keep the structure upright and takes a bit of effort to align the bars. But main reason for not giving 5 stars is that the Instructions are poorly written and explained with inconsistent drawings. Took a while to decipher how to do a few things. It feels really sturdy though, and kids seem to like it. So overall happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: bradd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Climbing Dome
customer_reviews.text: I chose the climbing dome because of all the great reviews not only for the product, but also for the great customer service and I’m so glad I did. It didn’t take long to put together and my 5 yo daughter loves it! One of the climbing handles broke upon installation and I emailed lifetime about getting a replacement. Not only did they get back to me quickly, but they also shipped out a new handle within 24 hours of my request. Would highly recommend this climbing dome to anyone looking to give hours of fun to their kids.
customer_reviews.author: viv0507

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this. Our 3 year old has a tough time getting up, due to the height of the first bar. But she will grow into it. Assembly was easy, and straight forward. Immensely faster with a second set of hands. Took about 1.5 hours total. It is strong and sturdy. My wife and I were both on it at the same time, and it still felt very solid. Easy to move. I can pick it up from one side, and drag it easy enough (probably not the best for the dome, but it works). Two people could easily carry it. Also, it came in its retail box, so if it is a gift beware.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this dome because it seemed like it would be useful for much longer than a playset and it was MUCH more affordable. I'm honestly still shocked it was only $180. It's very sturdy and BIG. I assembled it by myself and it took just under 2 hours. I thought the instructions were clear as I didn't experience any gotchas. I'm super impressed and can't wait for cooler weather so my 6 year old can enjoy it even more!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Vrana

customer_reviews.title: High quality and the kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: The 3 kids (ages 3-7) I nanny Absolutely love this! Hours of outside play. A great imagination stimulator. Love that the company offers a separate tent feature as an add on. It Definitely needs 2 people to assemble. The hand grips are a great safety feature. The tan and green color combo makes it blend into the background of the yard instead of screaming look at me I'm a huge play thing in the yard. The company's customer service is great! You can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Just be prepared to have a lot of patience as well as 2 to 3 hours to spare to put this thing together.
customer_reviews.text: It's holding up so far so good but man, its a pita to put together. Be prepared to spend no less than three hours putting this together and have a lot of patience for this type of thing. I put it together by myself but the directions say it takes two people and having an extra hand probably would have helped the building of this jungle gym go faster and smoother. Just don't get too rough on over tightening the nuts/bolts as I started out using a cordless drill but the torque of the drill snapped a bolt in half. Good thing you get an extra or two of some of the nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this! And the price point is really good for such a large outdoor play structure. I like that it won’t kill our grass, is easy to move around for mowing and the neutral colors look great in our backyard. My kids really get to use their imagination since it’s such a simple structure. I also love the climbing grips, they really help the kids hang on and get around on it. My husband used a socket wrench to assemble, he did it on his own and it took about 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not the colors i odered.
customer_reviews.text: First, lets start with positives! It is veru sturdy and the kids love it. Seems like it will last a long time and all parts were there upon arrival. Negatives, I ordered earth tone (the green and tan one). I did not receive the correct set. I don't know how hard it is when you only have to option to send the right one? Would have sent it back but my kids went nuts when it arrived and I opened the box. The direction are somewhat confusing and you will need two people to put it together for sure. Overall, it is what a good product.
customer_reviews.author: William stone

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy, kid is enjoying it.
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 3 hours to put this together by myself, definitely would have been easier with 2 people. Seems sturdy. I was able to move it a few inches by myself, which will be needed when I mow the yard. With 2 people it would be easy to move around the yard. I was looking for something big enough for my 9 year old to play on. Not a lot of options for older children that aren't super expensive. So far he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

customer_reviews.title: It's one of the best purchases I've made for my kids.
customer_reviews.text: I've got five kids nine and under and it works for all of them. You can put it together by yourself but it goes a lot quicker if you have another set of hand just to lean it on. You definitely need a socket wrench. A 13mm socket to be precise. It's for the black hand holds. The holes for the nut are recessed enough to need a socket. Make sure you pay attention to the labels on the pieces. I don't know how much of a difference there are but some of the shorter ones have narrower ends. So just keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Liquidmachine

customer_reviews.title: But its very sturdy and the kids enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: It did take a bit of time to put together (two adults) and I think the instructions could have been written more clearly. But its very sturdy and the kids enjoy it. As a bonus, our Wise Owl Outfitters kids hammock (for little kids) fits under it perfectly. The kids love to hang out under it and rubber-band blankets over the top to make a fort. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because of the assembly instructions and the fact that it was a large investment that the kids only use a couple times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Ain't Nobody Got Time For That

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Instructions were easy to follow. It's a Christmas gift so the kids haven't gotten to use it yet. And I don't know how it holds up to the sun and heat in the southeast United states. But so far, I am pleased with it. Feels sturdy, I climbed on it. Be sure to divide out the different bars to begin with. They r close in size and letter sequence. I had to take a few back apart, but that was my fault, not the instructions . I put it together by myself in just under 2 hrs, and I was talking on the phone to my brother for 1 hr of that time
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Steps are too high for young kids. Impossible to climb wihout gettig hurt.
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome for kids probably 10 years old and up or maybe even older. I have a big 4 yo son in 7-8 years clothes and steps are too tall him. He can not climb easily on his own. At some point I was about to throw it away when he came home with his legs covered in blue turning black spots all over from climbing. It is a great toy durable, but honestly poorly designed. It should have smaller stept rather then chest high. It is bad for young kids and probably not interesting for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Easy instructions
customer_reviews.text: I put it together by myself in just a couple hours. Instructions were ready to read and all parts were perfectly fit. Only criticism I have is in regards to the box being broken by three time it was delivered with some bars nearly falling out. Secondly the screws could be better quality. While tightening two of them the bolt broke in two. Luckily the manufacture provides extra screws, bolts, nuts and washers.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Claburn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: Received our dome in less than 24hrs and decide to build it right away. Took 2 of us to build it in 2hrs. I've seen reviews of people building it on their own, and awesome job on their part, I don't think I would have been able to do it alone. My kids absolutely love it! My, almost, 3 yr old took a bit to figure out how to climb it, but she did it! All of my kids love it (3,5, and 7) my 14yr old even climbed it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia S.

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad to put together once you figure out what the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I imagined but that's a plus for me. I didn't want a little rinky dink one. Not to bad to put together once you figure out what the directions are trying to do. They have you build 5 identical panels then assemble them together to make the structure. I thought I was trying to build it all at the same time from the ground up or too down. You will need at least one other person to help two would really be helpful. Once you figure out what your doing and are mechanically inclined it might take an hour to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Very great for kids. Need 2 people to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was a little difficult to assembly. Also you will need a socket wrench to put on the rocks for climbing. They should have put a wrench in the kit as well. So be prepared to have extra tools. I recommend having to people if not 3 to assembly and its hard to hold it up by yourself. Once its built is very strong. im over 200lbs and can easily climb and it does not bow at all. Very great overall product.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Good and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this almost 3 years ago, and have been very impressed with the durability. This sits in full sun, and no fading, no problems with this as well. I move it around for mowing, which is fairly easy with a single person, though it can alter the correct geometric shape slightly so you have to put it back how it's supposed to be, but it is never hard to do that. Sitting still, it has handled my 3 kids climbing all over it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea. Metal bends easily if dome is moved. Make sure it's in a permanent spot.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great idea. Kids do love playing with it. Cons: hard to put together. Not solid. Everytime we move it we worry we will bend the metal. Does not sit evenly on ground unless completely flat. We will have to lay rubber mulch in the summer and make a completely flat area in the yard for this to be stable/safe enough for the kids. This is not as sturdy and structurally sound as I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: The Bells

customer_reviews.title: No cursing during assembly but kids didn’t play with it much...
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to put together but wasn’t too terrible. No cursing during assembly is a good sign I guess but there were a few times I struggled. Feels sturdy enough for my big ole self and kids. They didn’t play on it much. But that’s not the manufacture fault. Too many video games probably stopped the kids muscles from forming and now they have to learn to climb up the thing. After a couple weeks the kids were able to make it halfway up. More practice required.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the 66” dome and absolutely love it! It took us 6 hours to put together but that’s because we messed up on installing a panel and our daughter played hide and seek with one of the bolts. She’s not quite old enough to climb it but loves to sit in the middle and build a fort etc. It is very sturdy and I see her growing into it!! We love it and we’ll worth the price we paid
customer_reviews.author: MaineChe

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it, sturdy, but takes a while to put together...
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 kids (ages 4 and 5) love this - its really big, sturdy, and well made. Beware it takes a while to set up and its a bit tricky at times, although directions are pretty well laid out. Definitely plan on SEVERAL hours for set up, and 2 people. We ended up setting it up over 2 days because we got frustrated... but we eventually figured it all out. I wouldn't attempt set up with just one person.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalDesigner

customer_reviews.title: Seems great except for a few little rust spots already
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to rate this one. We bought this for our daughter's 4th birthday. The instructions were a little weird, and we had to borrow a tool from my dad that could reach into the holes on the hand grips to tighten them sufficiently. But my husband was able to put it together in one morning. It's nice and big and our kids will grow into it. It's great except that we have some concerns with rust that we're seeing in the little punch-out holes on the bars after it being outside for less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: m4zurka

customer_reviews.title: kids love it, but cheap bolts
customer_reviews.text: overall, assembly wasn't too bad, but could it made it bit more clear. one thing i am very disappointed are the bolts that came with it. bolts must be made with play-doh. they elongate very easily and i have to buy bolts from hardware store to replace them. or sellers could send me new bolts. but than bolts they send me will be the same and will have issues.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Very used, arrived with half the parts in a box that was barely held together.
customer_reviews.text: The dome arrived a in a box that has children's drawings on the inside of the box. This would not normally be a problem, but it was definitely in used condition. Once I started to put it together it became obvious that many (nearly half) of the pieces were missing. I called the manufacturer and was told that replacement pieces were back ordered for 4-6 weeks. I returned the dome.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my backyard play equipment. Son-in-law put it together in probably 2 hours. Very sturdy and well made. Grandkids 21/2 to 8 all enjoy it and play on it every time they come over. Initially had to put a lawn chair beside it for the 21/2 year, that way he could get onto the first set of bars and work his way around it. Didn't take him long to figure how how to climb up to the top!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J

customer_reviews.title: Father of the year builds 3-year old dream-come-true, wins Memorial Day.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product and I think a fair price. I put it together myself in about 3-4 hours, leisurely pace. It would be very fast with two people. I'd say a fixed 13mm wrench and a 13mm socket wrench are required. Very sturdy, and the green/brown scheme helps it blend into my little yard without being too obnoxious. I dropped one star only because the matte powder coat (though pretty) makes the surface a little less "grippy" than the versions I've seen in playgrounds. Thus, my kid could really only climb it with a specific pair of shoes (Keens). Her normal sneakers were too slippery. She's three though, and I doubt it will be an issue in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! Fairly simple install, sturdy, easily moved.
customer_reviews.text: I put together mostly by myself (my 6 year old helped hold things in place when I needed an extra hand) and it took about 2.5 hours. My kids play on it daily and love it (6 and 3, and our neighbor who is almost 9 loves it too)! It is very sturdy, both my husband and I have been on it and the same time and it didn't budge. It is also easy to move by myself for mowing. This is one of the best purchases I have made for my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fun and well made
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!! I was able to put the first half together myself and when my husband came home we finish in less than an hour. Very easy to understand and work with ( while having a 4 year old to help lol) I have a larger 6 year old ( 80lbs) and a 4 year old. The spacing is a little wide for my 4 year old but she got onto it and can climb it now. They both love it!! Added a swing to the middle too.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearFedora711

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a long time to install
customer_reviews.text: Let's start at the end first. Once up and running, you'll see that this is an impressive product. Now, let's talk about GETTING it up! The directions are pretty well written, but grasping the early-stage concepts was a bit confusing... But I eventually got on a roll once I saw what was happening. That said, I ended up with around EIGHT HOURS of assembly time (single handed) under a 90 deg Texas sun... I'm usually pretty good at this sort of thing, but that was a LOT of work! That's why a four star review. Oh, and contrary to the mfr comments, under intense sun these bars ARE too hot to use...
customer_reviews.author: Edward Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok but bolts should be stronger
customer_reviews.text: The equipment seems durable enough so far in the short time we've had it (About 5 months with light use). However, the bolts should be stronger as I've had two bolts on two of the bottom-most joints shear off. No one has gotten hurt but I think it was because it was the bottom joints and the ground prevented the members from moving to much after failure. I am concerned that the upper bolts may fail as well, at some point, and that could cause some injury. I will be contacting the manufacturer to discuss options. At this point, I want to replace all the bolts for a higher grade type.
customer_reviews.author: Andvas

customer_reviews.title: the best geometric dome ever.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. this is the best geometric dome ever. It is large in height and diameter giving our granddaughters lots of climbing room. Our 11 year old can stand up in the center (she is about 5'1'). Both granddaughters climb and hang for hours. This dome has been a worth while investment for keeping our granddaughters physically active and "busy". After much debate we decided to keep the geometric dome in the garage so the girls could be physically active all year long.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for climbers!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy we purchased this! So far great for my kids ages 6 and 3. Even my husband can use it for working out (doing dips)! My kids love it! It was recommended To Us by a friend and my husband and I both thought, "really? This is great?" but I see why! It's sturdy, fun for multiple ages, seems like it will hold up well, and for the price I think a really inexpensive choice for a backyard activity. We just got it yesterday so I can't speak to how it last in the long run but it seems like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Smileygrlie

customer_reviews.title: Very fun for the kids but time-consuming assembly that is impossible to do alone
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly sturdy dome that our primary school kids LOVE to play on. The only kicker is that it takes several hours to assemble, and you really do need two adults to do it because the joints have to be held in place while you're screwing things together. Also, remember to put the long end of the screws facing OUT (not in) so you can attach the plastic hand holds later. The instructions don't make this very clear.

customer_reviews.title: Great product but...
customer_reviews.text: make sure and look on youtube for "how to put it together"...the instructions that come with it are absolutely confusing and make no sense. It's as if they were written by someone who speaks no english and/or had no earthly idea how to assemble this very cool product in a logical way. I'm only giving it 3 stars because of that assembly nightmare. Once together the product is VERY HIGH quality. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Flimsier than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: I put this together last fall. It has held up fine. I've had to move it around the yard a few times and I have to take extra care not to bend the flattened portion of the poles where they bolt together. The first few times I moved the climber it got bent out of shape. When it is stationary and being climbed on, it seems sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Derhammer

product_meta.title: Lifetime Geometric Dome Climber Play Center
feature_bullets: Heavy duty construction; weather and rust-resistant powder-coated steel
Strong, interactive design; high-density polyethylene (HDPE) climbing grips
Suitable for children ages 3-10; 600 lb. total weight capacity
10 feet wide and 5 feet high, assembled dimensions
10 ft. Diameter when assembled; 6 ft. radius safety zone suggested

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
